review_title: Jab Tak Hain Jaan has all the glitters but no gold. Big Letdown !!!!
review_detailed_main:
Jab Tak Hain Jaan was one of the most overrated movies of recent times which had all show and no substance at all.

Samar Anand (Sharukh Khan) is a musician who wants to make it big in London and struggles to meet his ends by doing small jobs. One fine day , he meets Meera(Katrina Kaif) and is head-over-heels for her. Eventually, Samar gets close to her and they fall for each other. However , destination separates them he loses her completely. He challenges death and joins Bomb Squad in back in India. Fate again takes him back to London where he meets with an accident and suffers from amnesia. In order to regain his memory back, all the people he met during his London days must help him to recover,including Meera. Will Samar regain back his memory and find his true love back ?

Directed by Yash Chopra (Deewar , Kala Pathar , Dil To Pagal Hain , Veer-Zara) , JTHJ was his last film after death. Sadly , the movie does not really take-off properly. Right from the first scene , you will wonder what is the story all about in this 3 hours long boring film with so many loop-holes. For instance , Katrina Kaif's younger version is shown as foreign kid with blond hair where as she is daughter of Indian parents? Sharukh Khan is diffusing bombs in every 5 mins without wearing any apparel as if he is diffusing some Diwali crackers and more over he is giving interview to Anushka while diffusing one of the bombs.. Anushka Sharma's introduction scene where she get into the middle of the river without getting wet and then Sharukh comes and saves her? Its high time that Indian directors don't take audiences for granted. Our Indian Hero can do anything in the film - He can play guitar , he can dance in the night club , he can join Bomb squad without basic training and even can woo any girl that comes his way. The film's pace becomes unbearable at certain point that you might want to leave the theater and take a break. I have never liked Yash Chopra's romantic saga. On contrary , I liked his action dramas more. Story is a complete let-down. Direction is weak and screenplay contains loop holes almost every where. Cinematography by Anil Mehta is spellbinding. Art Direction by Sharmistha Roy is superb. Music by A.R.Rahman is a BIG disappointment. I have been an ardent fan of Rahman's music but he has certainly been influenced by high-profile person and given his kind of music. Not a single song is memorable. Coming to performances, Sharukh Khan is good not great. He is repeating himself in the roles previously done in Veer- Zaara , K3G. I wish he does more of Swadesh , Dil-Se , Chak De India. Katrina Kaif is alright. Apart from looking good , she is just about OK. Anushka Sharma is playing the same kind of role she played in her previous films.

Jab Tak Hain Jaan has all the glitters but no gold. If you are die-hard fan of Sharukh Khan's romantic film , you might want to give it a chance but certainly not for everyone. Strictly Average 2.5/5

review_title: Just Short Of A Master Piece Yash Ji RESPECT!! SRK ROCKS :D
review_detailed_main:
A girl madly in love with a guy decides to leave him as she makes a promise to God to keep him hale and hearty. Yet another tries to win over the broken hearted soldier. This forms the backbone of Jab Tak Hai Jaan. And the feeling you had reading the first line would decide whether or not you would like the film or as Amandeep commented would want to advice Meera (the character Katrina plays) to go and watch OMG Oh My God! First.

It had a lot to look forward to JTHJ that is being Yash Ji's last film and genuinely the poignant yet romantic touch is so so there but I do feel Yash Ji's untimely demise does make it devoid of that mesmerizing finesse Veer Zaara had.

Shah Rukh as Samar the happy go lucky charmer during the first half of the film is the usual 28 year comic yet romantic 28 year old which he can play any day with ease(and a little hamming of course)and Superb as the tough mature major in the bomb defuse squad. He handles such roles with such precision that you just can't take your eyes off major Samar. Katrina Katrina Katrina is smoking hot and goes a step further in the sexy quotient from ek tha tiger.

But my heart hoots for Akira played by Anushka. In a role that is clearly overshadowed in terms of the quantity when compared to the other two leads Anushka still manages to be the one I loved the most in the film because of the sheer energy she puts in all the scenes she has with the right expressions every single time.

Ladakkh is exquisitely and beautifully shot making that part of the movie thoroughly enjoyable.

The pace slows down as the movie draws to an end and frankly a better ending was needed. For the movie lacked that sucker punch for which the audience waits for 3 hours. The music is good, just good.

Nonetheless its the ideal diwali watch if of course you want a brainless comedy instead.

Yash Ji salute :)

Jab Tak HaI Jaan 3/5

And an added 0.5 if you like surprises though I Did not !!

SRK we love you and we do not need a KISS to prove it ;):D

Shahrukh Khan (Samar) is an introverted army officer in the bomb disposal squad. He meets Anushka Sharma (akira), a tomboyish kind of girl who works for a wildlife channel. She starts liking Samar but Samar is lost in his past.After finding and losing his true love in London, Samar Anand defies death by becoming a bomb disposal expert for the Indian Army. Returning to London after 10 years, he suffers amnesia after an accident. Will he be reunited with his love?

review_title: JAB TAK HAI JAAN.... A Big Disappointment
review_detailed_main:
Movie is basically a copy of many movies and is mixed into one romantic disaster. It explains about 3 different stages of SRK's life. Firstly showing a life of a Major who detects bombs followed by a diary which explains SRK's romantic history in London and lastly about SRK's amnesia disease which was caused by two accidents in the movie. The movie keeps rotating in these 3 stages making it lengthy and boring. The beautiful sceneries, music, acting and looks of the 3 main actors and cinematography can be marked as the positives in this movie. Whereas, the poor script, storyline, direction and time span of 3hours are the negatives. The director tries to make this movie very touching and emotional but it actually ends up making the audience leave the premises as it lacks these two things completely.

In fact, the director fails to explain how SRK becomes a Major who defuses bombs from a struggling waiter, seafood seller and street singer. Besides this, SRK being affected by Amnesia gains his memory quickly and returns back to the army and continues his job of defusing bombs. Oh Common guys !!!! is it so easy for a soldier to leave the army and return to it??? None of this is explained in the movie.

To sum up, Jab Tak Hai Jaan is definitely the worst movie of the late Yash Chopra. I went for this movie hoping for a typical Chopra experience like Veer-Zara, Fanaa, DDLJ etc.. But it ended up in the list of my worst movies My Verdict : - 4/10 (1 each for music cinematography costume design & looks and lastly acting)

review_title: A well crafted movie and a subtly magnetic performance that is both charismatic and intense from Shahrukh Khan
review_detailed_main:
SRK is back again in what he does the best.. But, this movie offers you a tale of love than just romance.. It's about that one man's character Samar Anand that all would like to live.

SRK aka Samar Anand is from the Indian Army bomb disposal squad. He plays a pivoting role in the movie as a young happy go lucky man who falls in love with a NRI girl Katrina aka Meera in London. The story unfolds when Meera makes a promise to god in haste and SRK returns to India with anger and lives to die everyday. Yes indeed, It's a story of a man who cannot die. The introduction of SRK behind the picturesque Ladakh and Kashmir stands out to be the best of Yash Chopra's directing skills..

SRK's acting is charismatic, intense and brilliant and so is Katrina's. Anushka brings a lot of life in the storyline. I've no words to describe Yash chopra's direction. The Cinematography is at it's best.

It's a poetry on the celluloid though it has few weak moments where the story moves on a slower side and just when you realize that, it picks up very well with good twists..

Totally, JTHJ is a good watch and offers you a story never seen before....

review_title: The last Masterpiece from the Master of Love Stories!
review_detailed_main:
There is a tradition in Hindi cinema that whenever SRK comes with a movie for Diwali, it HAS to be a Box-Office Dhamaka. Baazigar, Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge, Dil to Pagal Hai, Veer Zara, Om Shanti Om, Don have proved it in the past. Yash Chopra - SRK combination began with Darr- the intensity and the obsession part in Love, then came Dil To Pagal Hai which showed the Destiny will always bring two people made for each other in Love. Then came Veer Zara, which told us that Love doesn't know boundaries, and all it knows is to sacrifice everything in the name of Love, including a man's identity.

What if all these three aspects are shown in a single movie? No wonder, it will be a completely emotional and beautiful treat, riding deeply on the emotion that rules the world- L O V E. And who else other than the King of Romance- Late. Yash Chopra, can tell this beautiful love saga in the most effective and the touching possible way! JAB TAK HAI JAAN is that! Revealing the story would be a spoiler, but at the same time, there is nothing highly unpredictable too. The story relies totally on the performances of the lead cast, emotions and the dialogs which were simple but with a lot of impact. There are umpteen number of scenes which gives you goose-bumps. The grandeur and the cinematography(Anil Mehta) you expect in a SRK-Yash Chopra movie lives up to the mark . The movie seems dragged in a couple of scenes, but is efficiently compensated, by the extremely beautiful screenplay by Aditya Chopra.

Summary: The last Masterpiece from the Master of Love Stories! Watch it right now, to just get immersed in the world of Love. Watch it for the greatest Lover in Hindi Cinema, SRK as Samar's intense performance, and Katrina as Meera's beliefs, and Anushka as Akira's energy!

For JTHJ, it was more than 8 and everyone was reviewing it as an epic love story. So, I went to watch it. First hour was good but thereafter the story didn't make any sense to me. I think the acting, direction, choreography and songs were good but the story/script was, I don't know what to say, I guess the word is "emotional atyachar" –(Emotional Torture), yes it was the same.

I do like fantastical activities in movies, as sometimes they make sense in an unusual way. But when the story seems to be a serious love story, any alien activity is not acceptable. The same happens in the movie. No one behaves in the real life the way the three main casts have behaved in the movie. Their behavior just bounced off my common sense and I was left with despair. I was disappointed.

review_title: Most Boring. This movie is a Disaster
Jab Tak Hai Jaan is a very boring movie.
review_detailed_main: Legendary filmmaker Yash Chopra signed off with a flourish with his romantic drama 'Jab Tak Hai Jaan' - his last film before his death this year. The film has his signature courtships and nuanced complexities set in India and London.But the film falls far short of expectations that come attached to swansongs. Chopra, who's the master of emotional dramas such as 'Kabhie Kabhie' and 'Silsila', simply fails to create a magnum opus with JTHJ. The scrutiny is greater because Shah Rukh Khan, the protagonist of the film, is back to the genre he ruled for over two decades before experimenting with science fiction and negative roles in classic remakes.So what went wrong in 'Jab Tak Hai Jaan'? And how could the film have been a better send-off for the iconic director.'Jab Tak Hai Jaan' falls far short of expectations that come attached to swansongs.Plot: For starters - the film is weighed down due to the lack of a cohesive plot. The film hinges on one women's promise to God to stay away from the man she loves for the rest of her life. It's not only far-fetched, it's downright silly. She makes that promise right after he is hit by a car. She makes her peace with Jesus Christ in the end, but not before she has wasted 10 years of her life. Shah Rukh on the other hand returns to India and enlists for the Indian Army - age be damned. The man who was shown waiting tables in London because he wasn't cut out for any specialized career, becomes the army's most coveted bomb disposal expert, to hell with logic. People expecting a tragic twist in the end were rewarded with a happy ending to the romance that waited its turn. But somehow the ending falls flat. A better screenplay would have elevated the film to another level.Cast: There is no doubting that Shah Rukh is Indian cinema's quintessential romantic hero. He's the boss in the matters of the heart. Or he was, until age begun to mark his face with its lines and creases. His 25-year-old portrayal of a busker in London just doesn't cut it. The heroines look much younger than him and his moments with Katrina came across as stiff and awkward. An older female lead cast would have worked wonders.Heroines: Heroines have always formed a crucial part of Yash Chopra's romances. From Rakhee to Rekha, Waheeda to Madhuri, the Chopra heroines are all about understated sensuality and elegance. Though immaculately turned out, Katrina is wooden throughout the film. She's glamorous and has perhaps scripted the best piece of percussive party dance number ever but fails to add depth to her character, making it very difficult for her audiences to feel any sympathy for her. Anushka Sharma as an over-eager intern for the Discovery Channel is much more believable. She tries to channel Kareena Kapoor in a 'Jab We Met'-type pitch to Shah Rukh, but for the most part she's annoyingly chatty and overdoes her brief.Music: This isn't your usual AR Rahman. The maestro's magic touch is lacking and none of the songs are memorable even after months of promotion. The selection of background voice artistes is poor, because Shah Rukh and Katrina's voice do not match with them and the resulting product jars on the ears. Different leads: Though it sounds improbable, but could Chopra have chosen different leads for his film? Though Shah Rukh makes the role his own, he does not fit into the lover-boy image at 47. Who could have worked for this role? Ranbir Kapoor would have been a good alternate choice along with Parineeti and Priyanka Chopra.Length: The length of Jab Tak Hai Jaan is a major issue. At 179 minutes it feels far too stretched. The editing could have been crisper.Attention to details: A struggling Pakistani, who could not hold down a job long enough to save some money to send back home, makes it big as the manager of a posh eatery in London in 10 years' time with the help of a fist full of bank notes. A rich NRI girl falls for the busker. A reporter shoves a camera in the face of a bomb disposal squad officer while he's defusing live ammunition. The same reporter, who is supposedly an expert swimmer, plunges into a freezing Ladakh lake for a dare and almost drowns. It's the lack of attention to details that takes away half the joy from watching JTHJ.Sex: Sex and intrigue have always been integral parts of Chopra's films. While a pair of dandelion would have sufficed in the 60s and a shot of two pairs of legs rubbing against each other in the 70s, it simply does not make the cut in 2012. Audiences are bred on much rougher stuff in films, videos and television series and the sexually loaded moments in the film fall flat.

Shahrukh Khan as Samar Anand was PERFECT!! He delivers it the way that only HE can do it and no one else. A dialogue post-interval opposite Katrina in the church proves it that he is the King and he rules!! Awesome performance. Words too less for him.

Anushka Sharma as Akira has done a fabulous job. Very impressed by the acting and performance. The character suits her perfectly. The only other actress that could have filled her shoes would have been Kajol. Two thumbs up to her!

These 3 have been a trademark tracks for each of the 3 characters. The background score by A.R. Rahman is simply unforgettable. I can still hear myself humming them. Hats off to his music. review_title: Weak script, redundant dialoguesYash Chopra's last was a very average YRF product. Jab Tak Hain Jaan - a Film review
review_detailed_main:
The movie starts with a poem being delivered by the man himself- Yash chopra. A tone of reverence for the filmmaker, whose last film as a director was going to be screened a few moments from then, was set.

Yash Chopra has created many 'Romances' in his long career. Often good scripts and mostly great songs have been integral part of his films. With so much done and achieved, his last film was, alas, far away from being called his 'best work'.

Jab Tak Hain Jaan is just another potboiler featuring YRF's favorite hero since the 90's and their formula female actors (i.e. the actors who are 'stars of the moment'). With great promotions (steeped with sentimentality's evoked around Mr. Chopra's sudden demise), large posters all around the metropolitan cities, SRK flanked by the two most hot actresses of the time and of course umpteen number of public appearances made prior to the release, this film just did not make it to the audiences' expectation.

What Mr. Chopra wanted to convey, perhaps never permeated through his film and instead too many questions arise. How does a person who does odd jobs (cleaning snow in front of a church in England, selling fish in a market, so on and so forth) after 10 years become the Major in the Indian army? How does a girl (Anushka) who loiters around all the time with all her antics and hysterics, end up with a documentary that goes on to become the main cover story in none other than Discovery Channel?

As if these anomalies were not enough, there is a long list of them. To start with, the film had a very weak script and an inept Shahrukh Khan as the 28 year old in the 1st half, fidgeting around without doing much (one of the most unconvincing performances ever by him). There was Katrina Kaif who just delivered her dialogues on time without taking much pain into emoting and an Anushka Sharma whose presence almost had a screeching effect due to the boisterous rendition of her character in almost all the scenes.

However, the 38-year-old Shahrukh in the second half came as a relief, as here he played his part quite convincingly. YRF movies are known for their mesmerizing songs, here too there was a big disappointment. Barring one 'saans mein teri saans mili to', all others were slack and does not leave any mark.

The movie ends with shots and scenes featuring Mr. Chopra directing the cast in various locations. It was a real pleasure to see Mr. Chopra behind the scenes instructing his actors. The mental effort that went into figuring out who is doing what in the 3-hour long drama, mellowed down with the solemnity embedded in the last few minutes. The tone set in the beginning found its connection in the end.

Jab Tak Hain Jaan is a watchable film that will be remembered more for being the last directed movie by the great crafter of Bollywood, than for anything else.

P.S- After watching the film, I realize the best part of it was used in the promotions thereby creating an illusion of poetic extravagance – its amazing poetry.

review_title: Bearing the magical stamp of a Yash Chopra romance...
review_detailed_main:
A generation grew up watching Love defined by Yash Chopra's films. The stories evolved with time but the essential magic of Yash Chopra's direction and story telling was timeless. The now Late filmmaker's swan song is a tribute to romance and the genre that pretty much belonged to him only. Even though it may be flawed in its story and screenplay, 'Jab Tak Hai Jaan' is a fitting end to an era of old school romance with all its cheesiness, emotional quotient, drama, melodious music, spectacular scenery, stunning outfits and memorable dialogs.

After diffusing his 98th bomb without a suit, Major Samar Anand (ShahRukh Khan) rides along on NH-1, narrating the title poem while we witness some of the most breath-taking visuals of the Ladakh region. Akira Rai (Anushka Sharma) is an intern with the Discovery Channel who, after being rescued from the freezing waters of Pangong Lake by Samar, shamelessly goes through his personal diary to take us into flashback. The younger Samar was a multi-tasking, striving immigrant in London who charmed its people with his melodious singing, customer service and dimpled smile. He met the newly engaged Meera (Katrina Kaif) and their friendship formed as a tutoring exchange. With Samar, she opened up to being herself in ways she never knew and before long, Samar fell in love with that self. Inspite of vows taken in church to not cross the line, they end up romancing to Saans all over London. An unfortunate accident made Meera choose between her love and faith, resulting in Samar's return to India and his subsequent enrollment into the Indian Army's bomb squad. Akira gets permission to shoot a documentary on the fearless bomb diffuser and while doing so, she falls for his love for Meera. Being a generation younger, Akira has a different recipe for love and the old fashioned ways of Samar charm her only to disappoint her when she confesses her feelings. Upon her return to London, BBC requires verification to air her story and that brings Samar to the city he vowed never to go back to. That's when the love triangle takes its real shape.

What makes Yash Chopra's approach to romance special, is the subtle poignancy with which he depicts situations. A simple dialog can convey depth and relevance without the need for thundering background music and close up angles. It's not all about the romantic song sequences and mushy one-liners. Yash Chopra's direction brings exemplary performances from the actors and along with well written, meaningful dialogs, he brings the depth in simple confrontations that eventually make his films memorable.

Neetu Singh's cameo is really special. Even without her physical presence, the emotion she conveys in the narration of the letter read by Meera is par excellence. Then, it is the charmer Rishi Kapoor's dialog that establishes the basis of the film. Anupam Kher is surprisingly underutilized in the film but one must be thankful as it prevents the mundane father-daughter-poor lover saga. Anushka Sharma starts off being over-the-top but soon turns likable with her natural depiction of the carefree Akira. Katrina Kaif is at her best in this film. Not only is it her best performance after 'Rajneeti' but she looks her stunning best in every scene even if she puts up a serious face most of the time and shows the lack of versatility in emoting. She does look Jaw-droppingly sexy in Ishq dance and Ishq Shava where her dance is commendable. There is a reason why he is the King of Romance. He can experiment with 'Swades' and 'Chak De India' but it is Yash Chopra that made ShahRukh Khan who he is and he revives him yet again, in a role that was tailor-made for him. The intensity with which he loves and the liveliness he infuses in Challa and Saans are attributes that make him a remarkable lover-boy. He plays the immigrant Samar and Major Samar Anand with distinct emotions that are in total control. While his confrontation with Meera is depicted with controlled frustration, his outburst against God in church is explosive. Only two men have stood convincingly against God in movies and both were directed by Yash Chopra.

Yet, this isn't a flawless movie. What prevents JTHJ from being a great film is Aditya Chopra's story and screenplay. An accident causing amnesia is an age-old twist in the story and this lack of imagination has not only lengthened the film unnecessarily by 30 mins but also made it less celebratory in the end. Anil Mehta's cinematography shows London in all its glory and Kashmir in all its beauty. Every scene with the landmarks or actors looks very well composed.

A.R. Rahman's music falls short of the big expectations. His experiment with mostly new singers failed to create any magic. Saans is definitely the best track that requires repeated listening that you can't get enough of. Ishq Shava is a groovy track and certainly the best choreographed one in recent times. Heer is melodious but not much to playback on. The title song required a better singer and so did Jiya re which sounds like a teenage Ila Arun screaming.

Yash Chopra leaves us with a legacy that shall remain inimitable. To many, he taught what true love and romance is in a way that people still desire in their hearts. A director who made films only when his heart told him to and films with a heart they all turned out to be. 'Jab Tak hai Jaan' may not be his best romantic work ('Veer Zaara' is the title contender to that) and it is flawed in its story and screenplay but as a finale to a prolific and much decorated career, it still bears his stamp, his trademark style of story telling. Enjoy the fantasy while you can. There aren't too many who believe in it anymore.

Now bottom line is this is poorly made movie. Yash Chopra was a far better director than this. I do not really know whats good about movie other than names associated with it. Other than locations of Ladakh etc we have same old London. Biggest complaint that I have about this movie is loads of Plot holes. Yes we know Bollywood and how it requires you to leave your brains behind but then I thought YC was better than directors making mindless comedies. Another complaint is how poor costumes of both girls are. Katrina is beautiful but she is wearing teenager clothes in most of the movie which make her look awkward. Anushka 's whole character is loud and overacted. She has to wear hot pants throughout no matter what weather or location. SRK looks so old. He needs to realize that he does not look anywhere near 25 year old that he pretends to play in the movies. I know SRK can act and has done so many times in Romantic movies but in this movie he was not at his best because the character and plot is so weak and clichéd. Yash Chopra should have chosen a better story or just not make another movie. This movie being his last does no justice to his legacy.

There are no stand out scenes , no stand out performances , no comedy , no romance in this one.Only saving grace were songs like Challa ,Ishq Shava and Saans which were really good but other songs are very average. Only people who can love this movie are people who can close down their common sense and objectivity. If you are craving a good movie of SRK why not watch one of his older ones and same goes for Yash Chopra.

review_title: A resoundingly fitting swansong to the legacy of Yash Chopra
review_detailed_main:
Film: Jab Tak Hai Jaan (2012)

Rating: 4/5 stars

Reviewed By: DareDevilKid_DDK

If you are in love, ever been in love, or just believe in love, then please go & watch it. If you think that "LOVE" is just an unprioritized four-letter fluffy word, then you should most certainly go & watch it. It does have its minor flaws & is a tad lengthy, but at its core is a triumphant tale of romance which leaves an indelible mark in our hearts, & this coming from a guy who generally abhors love stories, but this saga ranks right up there with such classics as 'Titanic' & 'DDLJ'.

The performances are vibrantly immaculate. Anushka is splendid, Katrina is joltingly astounding, & Shahrukh is brilliant, dynamic & reliable as ever.

At the end of the day, this movie might or might not jump the bandwagon of the 100 crore club, but its profound aura of 'love conquering all odds' will remain etched in our hearts & minds for 100's of years to come. Sigh......they just don't make love stories like these any more, & Yashji, you Sir, will be sorely missed forever!

review_title: Jab Tak Hai Jaan,The Best Movie Ever!
review_detailed_main:
Jab Tak Hai Jaan, the last movie by the great legend Yash Chopra is an outstanding movie. It can be considered as one of the best ever. The performances by Shah Rukh Khan,Katrina Kaif & Anushka Sharma are wonderful and really heart touching.Hats off to the one and only A.R.Rahman for the wonderful music.This is truly an amazing film.It is a treat to watch throughout the 3 hours. I really loved watching it.

It is the story of Samar Anand(Shah Rukh Khan) who was in London in an simple but happy way.Meera(Katrina Kaif) comes into his life.While teaching her how to sing he falls in love with her.They like each other but Meera promises in front of god,that she will not be together with Samar because her father wants her to marry someone else.Samar faces an accident and Meera feels scared that his life will be lost as she promised god.She tells her that they cannot be together.Heartbroken Samar goes back to India where he battles with life and death everyday as a Bomb Disposer in Indian Army.Akira(Anushka Sharma) meets Samar and finds out about his story from his diary.Akira gradually falls in love with him.While Samar comes back to London to help Akira to complete her documentary he mets with another accident.He loses his memory.His memory is back to the time where he had a similar accident while he was with Meera.Akira meets Meera and tells her the situation.Meera acts as Samar's wife in order to make him happy and feel better. But one day Samar disposes a bomb on a train, while doing that his memory comes back.Heartbroken Samar goes back to India.But Meera comes to India to meet him.He is finally able to get together with her after 10 years. Akira presents her documentary calling it "The Man Who Cannot Die."

For the performances Shah Rukh Khan is absolutely superb as Samar Anand. This is one of his career's most challenging roles which he does so perfectly.He does full justice to his role.He shows a wide versatile performance as his role as Major Samar Anand contrasts from his early life in London.He looks great with Katrina Kaif who also does her role extremely well.She gives a heart touching performance as Meera.As always she is able to charm the audience and she gives a great performance, looking wonderful throughout the movie.She looks sweet as the young Meera.The chemistry she shares with Shah Rukh is great to watch.The Jodi looks fantastic in all the songs specially the heart touching Heer,Sensual Saans and of course Ishq Shava is totally stunning. Anushka Sharma is bubbly,cool,gorgeous and she is simply wow.As innocent Akira she gives her best performance in her career till date.She looks great in Jiya Re.

Mr.Yash Chopra have given us a wonderful movie,his final salute to us. The great legendary filmmaker who gave so many lovely movies, the king of romance will be forever remembered. Bollywood fans around the world will always remember you sir, Jab Tak Hai Jaan...

review_title: Please don't take such a senseless film Jab Tak Hai Jaan, Jab Tak Hai Jaan
review_detailed_main:
I don't have anything good to write about this film except their effort behind this film. It shares a disappointing experience for the film lovers. Even the Classical love story genre has been out-fashioned in this digital world. And, they still project the unrealistic illogical senseless romantic story-line. Why can't these so called superstars realise the pulse of this present day world? Let them come down to earth from their heavenly Utopian world.

There's no age limits for this hero to get into the Indian Army, miraculously he even gets a lover that's 20 yrs. younger to him, and disappointingly this film bores the viewer for 3 hours with a host of unnecessary songs. I believe the audience will never forgive this Jab Tak Hai Jaan Jab Tak hai Jaan...

review_title: Yash Chopra Should Have Saved Veer Zaara As His Last Tribute To Hindi Cinema.
review_detailed_main:
I feel happy that I saw this from the internet for free and did not waste any money on cinema viewing.

Katrina Kaif is such a expressionless artist. There is no depth of feeling that we saw Preity Zinta give in Veer Zaara. Also Mr. S.K. Khan's face is showing signs of accelerated aging.

The plot of the film is handled very badly. The scene where S.R.K's character has the 1st accident seems like an episode of Jackass. The 2nd one is even funnier. Even with a motorcycle helmet on, this guy sustains head damage. Unbelievable!

These days they expect us to believe everything that happens in films happens "exactly" in real-life.

Anushka Sharma is a better actress than Katrina, and I think she was good enough for the lead role. Katrina should have been give the side role.

Brief plot of film: Samar Anand (Shahrukh Khan), a major in the Indian Army, defuses a bomb showing no fear or regard for personal safety. After a while, Akira Rai (Anushka Sharma), a Discovery Channel filmmaker, dives into a river in Ladakh and is rescued by the major. Samar gives her his jacket but leaves before retrieving it. Akira finds his diary in the jacket pocket and starts reading.

The diary recounts Samar's earlier years as a struggling immigrant in London. He worked as a musician and found other menial jobs to support him and his roommate. One day Samar is offered work as a part-time waiter where he meets Meera (Katrina Kaif) during her engagement party. In exchange for English lessons, Samar agrees to teach her how to sing. In the process, Samar and Meera fall in love. On the day Meera is supposed to tell her father about their relationship, Samar gets into a terrible accident. Meera prays to God to save his life and makes a vow to never meet him again. Soon Samar makes a speedy recovery and comes to know about the vow. In anger he tells her to go away and leaves London. Samar challenges God to keep him alive while he will risk his life everyday because he believes his death is the only way to make Meera lose her faith in the deity who stole his love. He goes to India and enlists in the Indian Army.

Verdict: this film is not like Veer Zaara. Teenagers will find this film appealing as the film is directed towards them. Older viewers will find this film a real drag and will maybe leave the film halfway.

List Of Good Films: Prem Pratigya, Ghar, Agar Tum Hote, Amar Prem, Ram Teri Ganga Maili, Saagar(Dimple Kapadia Rishi), Saajan, Gol Maal(Amol Palekar), Chhoti Si Baat, Aaina, Prem Rog, Parinda, Yeshwant, Aadmi Ek Khilona Hai, Ek Duuje Ke Liye(Kamal Hassan, Rati Agnihotri), Henna, Swaami(Manoj Bajpai, Juhi Chawla), Beta, Fanaa, Parineeta, Tere Naam, Devdas(Dilip Kumar Classic), Baghban, Benaam Badshah(Anil Kapoor Classic), Eeshwar(Anil Kapoor Classic), Woh Saat Din(Naseeruddin Shah), Pestonjee(Naseeruddin Shah), Masoom (a Shekhar Kapoor film), Ek Ghar (1991).

Long Live Hindi Cinema!

review_title: Jab Tak Hai Jaan - "The Movie that cannot DIE"
review_detailed_main:
don't judge the movie by its running time, OR try to make logic in every other scene ... sometimes, to display all correct EMOTIONS on screen, you have to defy few logic.On the contrary ITS a DRAMA/ROMANTIC MOVIE SPANNING OVER DECADES ..HOW MUCH TIME CAN A DIRECTOR HAVE ..???

The movie kick-start (Enfield) with beautiful Kashmir, opening scene, with fantastic poetic narration = Rahman's background Score + Gulzar thoughts + SRK voice "teri aankhon ki namkeen mastiyaan ......."

Drama/Romantic Story follows good directions by late MR.YASH CHOPRA, stretched but enough twist to keep one glued till the credits roll.

CLASSIC performance by SRK as Major Samar Anand i.e. "THE MAN WHO CANNOT DIE" , Katrina's portrayal of Meera is slightly low in comparison to Shahrukh's and Anushka's acting.

Cinematography is beautiful throughout the movie - London and Kashmir.

Nice soundtrack by A.R.Rahman and group, special mention - Challa, Saans and JTHJ Fantastic lyrics penned by Gulzar Sahab.

************************************************

Movie meant for any time, any season, for any lover ...

review_title: Couldn't even sit through the entire film. Shallow stupidity all the way.
review_detailed_main:
Wow what a low point this film was for a director who has given us classics like Kala Pathar, Kabhie Kabhie and Silasila. I think Yash Chopra just didn't put his heart and mind into this one... at all.

Lets start with the weakest of all things, the plot and the script. Without giving anything away, I haven't seen a weaker plot in a film by a serious film-maker in some time. The love stories had no depth to them whatsoever. There was no believable reason for any character in this film to truly fall in love with any other character, at all. Felt like a miserable, immature, failing teen rom-com throughout the first half, and that too with a misfit Sharukh Khan playing a 25 year old. Felt as if even he was just passing time with this one. Then there were twists in the plot that remind one of the worst part of the 1980's plots. Sharukh Khan's character was one self pitying guy looking for audience's sympathy. He should stop doing that. It looks pathetic. The characters were not well thought out at all. Katrina's was plain stupid, the other girl was way over the top and Shahrukh was massively unconvincing in whatever weak characterization he was given.

Don't even get me started on the script and dialogs. When will these guys mature and produce intelligent stuff rather than soap-opera-ish junk?

Overall a pain to sit through. The funny moments were not funny, cute moments were irritating, romantic moments were uninspiring, and tragic moments were ice-cold. What a waste of everything including money, time, efforts, film-making.

Personally I think when directors age, they lose track of what the youth is really going through, and produce films based on what they think the youth must want, based on a very surface level understanding. They should either do a thorough cultural research, or better just make less commercial, mature films which depict their real selves and frames of mind rather than their forced young selves. As far as SRK is concerned, he should get his act together, choose scripts more intelligently, act his age, and also stop obliging friends by starring in their crappy films.

Please don't bother watching this utter non sense.

review_title: An epic Love-Story, from the one an only Yash Chopra!
review_detailed_main:
Watched Jab Tak Hain Jaan! Initially planned to wait for it until the arrival of dvdrip, but couldn't resist myself from downloading the film this week! an emotional master-class from one and only yash choprafinally in a movie Katrina got the chance to act and I felt she was more than okay, Anushka simply rocked and next year she is gonna get all the awards for best supporting actress female, without any doubt! Nothing to say about SRK, he just did it once more what he does best.

Story is a long one and at time some twists and turns will be felt like its way too much cinematic (1 in a 1000 times chance of happening in real life!) but again it's a film. it's a film where the hero is an expert who defuses bombs without wearing the bomb-suit, without any protection! But its not a story of courage, its not a story of miracles, its just a simple story of love:) Awesome background music, Challa-Saans-Jiya Re these 3 songs were beautifully placed and choreographedoverall a nice film just a bit long2hrs 55 minutes! but its one of those few bollywood movies that are both critically and financially successful.

review_detailed_main:

Again bad acting by SRK.

Some illogical concepts in the movie. Some of them are:

When Anushka jump in the lake at Ladakh from the stone which was located at the center of lake. How she reached to the stone without touching the cold water of the lake.That scene also look too much animated.

review_title: An Epic Unforgettable love story ever
The poorest amongst all of Yash Chopra's Film
Jab Tak Hai Jaan and Beyond
review_detailed_main:
There are commercial movies, art movies, action movies, horror movies, thriller movies and yes now remakes and then there are Yash Chopra Movies. Movies that entertain you, make you dance, make you laugh, make you cry and above all make you love the life.

Jab Tak Hai Jaan has it all and beyond. What makes Jab Tak Hain Jaan special from Yash Ji's earlier movies is the narration, characterization. When he shoot portions in Kashmir and Ladakh he never did it for the sake of Natural beauty. Switzerland, lush green mountains a sort of character in all his movies is not there in this one. But nature plays a important role in narration. And that's what Yash Chopra is. The portions shoot in ladakh are not romantic considering its rough mountains, light comic scenes in kashmir valley and some thrills of bomb defuse in street of Kashmir. Kashmir is not there just for scenic beauty.

There are actors, there are heroes, there are superstars, there are stars and there is Shah Rukh Khan. He needs no special dialogs he makes ordinary ones very special. His eyes speaks thousand words..Jab Tak Hai Jaan makes you believe that here is someone who redefines acting. A classic performance from a legend.

It's hard to select who is better Katrina or Anushka though few may say Anushka but that's due to her character. What Darr did to Shahrukh's career and his way of acting Jab Tak Hai Jaan will do to Katrina and Anushka...watch their performances post Jab Tak Hai Jaan...now on they can make a ordinary role a talk about.

There were mix reactions about Music but once you saw the movie you will agree this is the best music. Like all Yash Chopra movies music of Jab Tak Hai Jaan is not for making popular music but it is important part of movie. For Example Challa song or Heer song...you may wonder why out and out Punjabi song? but when you watch the movie you come to know they are in Punjabi for a reason.

Technically movie is stunning...cinematography is awesome and so is choreography. Few may fill the movie is slow...but then understand love stories are not Action or thrillers where you want a fast paced narration. Love Stories do need their own time to move on.

My wife who don't really like watching movies..loved this one very much and for the first time asking me to go for it again....For me all reviews and collections are useless now.

To conclude....this is not the last movie of Yash Chopra for me....through the future performances of Shahrukh, Katrina and Anushka Yash Ji will talk to us....and with smile will say Main Yahan Hoon Yahan Hoon Yahan Hoon Yahan This movie is special in many ways...DON'T MISS IT

review_title: To its credit, a well-made movie, but difficult to relate to
review_detailed_main: I was slightly disappointed with this film, but I wouldn't write it off completely. Cinematography and music are excellent. Katrina is fabulous. Performances are good. The main weakness of the film is the story. The fault lies not in that it is told poorly or that it is devoid of any intelligence. It just is kind of old-fashioned, and I found it difficult to relate to. Chopra did make a good attempt of trying to address this point with Anushka's character, but she still seemed more of a stereotype of Gen Y rather than a sincere incorporation of its viewpoint. Thank goodness, the climax is well-done and refreshing.

review_title: Jab Tak Hai Jaan Is Superb
review_detailed_main:
Hi Watched Jab tak hai Jaan of Shahrukh Khan Its a Superb Movie and Must watch for All.

A unique Love Story with perfect twist and turns yash chopra has given his best at the end of his career Shahrukh khan is just out of this world no words to express his cinematic brilliance,Perfect timing with great emotions.

A R Rehman Has created magic again, best music of this year Gulzar has written beautiful lyrics..

the movie is a treat...

Go and watch with the family ..a perfect family entertainer Katrina in his best ever performance..

But believe me anushka will be loved the most..

review_title: Great movie called it a "Best of Both world" concept using in Romance
review_detailed_main: Great Movie to watch treat to eyes in this diwali which maded awesome by late Mr.Yash Chopra jee, he again proves that from the time of our father and to the time of our grandchildren, he,always remains the king of romance and it is our fortunity and luck to born in his era era of film making Again Shah Rukh Khan Proves that Romance and Grey or Dark Roles is his territory and his collections in overseas is unteachable. A great story which reveals a life of a musician an lover boy too, awesome performance by SRK and specially done a great work with Katrina.....!!!!!!!! The Both roles of lover boy and army man is greatly done by SRK and the cinematography is mindbogglingly audience have to hold their hearts because the sequences done and performed by SRK or Anushka is great to watch katrina plays both romantic and serious roles excellently some places were you have to think what the characters have done next and why they done the things in it which can be expressed in word like expressive acting of both Kat & SRK which left the audience speechless then pls friends if you have any work left finished it & go to Multiplexes,Theater or cinema halls this movie is worth it for you and your loved ones a full family entertainer Film by Late Yash Jee & SRK

review_title: Classic love recipe cooked by extraordinary cook with addition of many new spices
review_detailed_main:
Jab tak hai jaan :First of all pls listen all idiot,silly,hate-infested brains.. Movie is not a remake of DAAG.... not a bit... nor a south spice...

Now keeping cap down as SRK's die hard fan... I am giving real feedback from heart...Surely I like the film as it is one of the great attempt to renew old love story concept with modern but logical finishing. Performances:No word require to adore SRK's performance... You will realize Katrina is going to be one of the challenging dancer in future projects.... I need few grams of Glucose to praise energy shown by cute , pretty Anushka... She plays role like Virat Kohli does to score few extraordinary shots ... she really stretches your lips.... Rishi Kapoor, Neetu singh, Anupam Kher are best as cameos ... Direction: It is clearly visible that Yash chora did want to make his last cut as precious as possible... he has used all of his master strokes... D.O.P. leaves your eyes so stunned... coolest , sexiest frames... no comparison only negative part is tooooo much length and some scenes which could be thrashed .... ( as I said Yashji may have wanted to show each of his masterstroke )

Story: Not so different Love saga but many new tadaks and twists....

Overall: Classic love recipe cooked by extraordinary cook with addition of many new spices... though it may prove Heavy dish for many people... Please don't miss it.. it may receive - ve signs from fastfood lovers... yet You should not miss this.. *** + half*

Totally illogical storyline with some beautiful songs. A middle aged waiter in London who makes extra bucks by singing on the street suddenly gets the 'fitoor' of joining the prestigious and difficult to enter Indian army as an officer and has suddenly become a bomb squad expert who has diffused 97 bombs without any safety gear. SRK does pull out his usual charm and Katrina looks ravishing while Anushka is a touch and go. Songs, background musical score is the only thing that makes the movie worth watching once. The Yash Raj gang needs to understand that the modern Indian audience needs matured content and has got bored of same run of the mill movie storylines. Just watched it to remind myself of lost love, otherwise the movie doesn't make sense.

review_title: One of the worst movies i have seen in my film career
review_detailed_main: So boring.. actually a comedy for the time i spent watching this mockingly unrealistic film.. i mean can you imagine all time bombs of the world in one place and only one person is willing to dispose them without wearing the Bombsuit. hilarious ... very weak story throughout the film. characters are not even behaving like actors. The actor experiences same accident in 10 years twice and one time his head is injured on right side, other time on the left side.. the dialog are so hollow ..looks like they made it up for the street guys... In a nutshell .. recommended for a comedy but NOT recommended in millions lives if you have and you know what i mean :P

wow yash chopra is great director.one of my faviroute movie simply superb.The great movie from great legend.Shah Rukh Khan delivers a good performance as the brooding Major Anand. He looks good in army fatigues. He is famous for his lover boy roles and he pulls off yet another one quite convincingly. Anuskha Sharma is superb as the hyper energetic Akira Rai. She is a big asset to the movie and her scenes with SRK are actually quite endearing.Jab Tak Hai Jaan is a film that has all the ingredients you expect in a Yash Chopra film but somehow, it does not work out this time. The film is way too long, painfully slow at times and the magic is missing between SRK and Katrina. Anushka is excellent though. Watch the film if you can take the slow pace and if you want to catch Yash Chopra's last flick..Don't miss it.............

Ever since the late Yash Chopra, released "Veer Zaara" in 2004, I was waiting for him to Direct another movie but had to wait for eight years. Then in 2011, it was announced that he was Directing a movie with Shah Rukh Khan, Anoushka Sharma and Katrina Keif. There was no mention of the title and when this was announced, the release date was also mentioned. A fearless officer in the Bomb Squad, saves a young, female Journalist / Reporter who finds a diary of the officer who had saved her and decides to make a programme of his life before he joined the Armed Forces and in particular the romance side of it.

Starring Shah Rukh Khan, Katrina Keif, Anoushka Sharma, Kris Somerville, Anupam Kher, Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor. Music By: A R Rahman. Lyrics: Gulzar.Produced By: Aditya Chopra. Directed By (late) Yash Chopra.

Shah Rukh Khan, is convincing as the fearless officer in the Bomb Squad as he portrays facial expressions that make the audience think whether he will be able to defuse a bomb or not. His role and character show what the men in the Bomb Squads go through. As always he is good.

Katrina Keif. Well I was not really impressed with her acting until this movie - with the exception of "New York," in which she appeared alongside with Neil Nitin Mukesh and John Abraham. As a daughter of a rich businessman, who is due to get married but then has second thoughts,she is very convincing and the role is most appropriate and suits her.Her dancing steps and moves are also very impressive.

Anoushka Sharma,who last appeared in "Ladies Vs Ricky Behl," as a young Journalist /Reporter, is also excellent. She is young and represents the current youth and it is through her that the audience sees the earlier life of the Officer who saves her life. From "Rab Na Bana Di Jodi," "Band Baja Baraat," and "Ladies Vs Ricky Behl," her character in this movie, is completely opposite to the roles in the films that I have mentioned. Her character is the type that is young, fearless and energetic and will do anything to achieve her goal – in this case the story of the Army Officer.

Anupam Kher, Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor, make a very brief appearance in the movie, but yet their characters punch an impact in the story and perhaps that is where the mastery of the story writers – Devika Bhagat and Aditya Chopra, really is at the best. For they have created characters, who, though have a small part in the story, but they make an impact.

For the first time, since "Slumdog Millionaire" was released, Music Director A R Rahman and the Lyricist, Gulzar, have come together and have, again composed some excellent and memorable songs and music – "Ishq Shava" and "Saans" being the two most memorable numbers along with the "Chala" song.

Directed by the late Yash Chopra,this movie does bring some memories in some scenes, of the previous movies that he Directed – "Kabhi Kabhie," "Silsila" and "Veer Zaara." His "signature" of mountains and snow falling and romance, is written and can be seen very clearly on the screen and yet this can be considered as not a typical "Yash Chopra" movie. The scenes between Shah Rukh Khan and Katina Keif are the ones to watch out for.

Conclusions: Though the movie has some flaws, it is one that is worth watching, even though many may feel that it may not be so. This is a Yash Chopra movie and he will be remembered for it.

Below average music, average story and good performances by Shahrukh and Anushka makes the movie barely watchable. Katrina does not impress at all. Girls showed some skin throughout the movie but some of scenes seemed forced. Used good locales especially the country sides in UK. Have not seen him use these locales before. However the locales in India seem to be ones from Tashaan and 3 idiots.

At the end of day not what we expect from Yash Chopra. Seems like someone forgot to edit the movie altogether. Jab tak hain jaan , the poem is nicely done. however the songs and lyrics not up to par with Chopra movie productions. Watch it for being Yash Chopra's last movie but nothing special at all.

review_title: Grand love story of new generation ! Epic !!

review_detailed_main: As the summary says, this movie is a classic example of a Bollywood movie, which does not make any sense at all. It's the result of casting big stars, shooting at exotic locations, pouring money on everything but a good enough writer. The writing is extremely week and the movie totally sidelines common sense. Various scenes vital to the story are shot thinking of the audience to be a 12 year old kid. Scenes were stolen from movies like 'The hurt locker' and enacted poorly. For example, the scene where SRK's character is defusing a bomb. It was a real challenge to sit through this awful experience of a love story.

After watching this movie i was feeling like after a decade i have seen a good movie in Bollywood. without any comparison i will say this movie is an another great movie after 3idiots in Bollywood. ah! the music , the performances, the direction , the cinematography all are good.i will say watch it and experience a romantic extravaganza. sadly Mr. Yash chopra is not with us any more but he made a masterpiece before his last breath. there are more than 50 movies releasing per year in India but some of them leaves its mark. Jab Tak Hain Jaan is one of them. Actor Shahrukh Khan is still a Romance king. its proved again. there is only one point which i want to say that is the duration of the movie is bit lenghty. overall if you love romantic films you not gonna feel bore. thats for sure.

review_title: this epic movie is awesome for the emotion drama romance comedy lovely movie.

Those subtle, nuanced, romantic sweet nothings that were engendered from the brain of that man, have always had a way with people. no matter how much they would want themselves to be impervious to that emotion called love.Samar and his eternal love story keeps you entertained through out.Although it depends how you would the ending to be.I liked it.The story is very strong well-presented.100000 cheers.Acting was outstanding.costumes was good.Location was beautiful,.the crisis and situations are very well accepted.Yash Chopra's direction, and Shah Rukh Khan's acting - hats off to both!LOTS OF CLAPS FROM ME.

review_title: an intense romantic movie (must watch) teaches us to love truly n without any expectations
review_detailed_main:

review_title: Good romantic movie but not Yash Chopra's best
review_detailed_main:
Having seen it just few hours ago...Jab Tak Hai Jaan feels how brilliantly Shah Rukh Khan returned to his best form with his role of Samar after his dare-devil acts in Ra-One and Don 2,Romance is best suited for him undoubtedly. This also marks Yash Chopra's final movie in direction and also before his death which has significantly increased the movies value massively, but notably it isn't Yash Chopra's best.

Katrina Kaif I feel gave her best as a Yash Chopra heroine, and her acting was quite brilliant and so was the quirky, cool, naughty Anuska Sharma who played the Discovery Documentarian Akira.

All in all a movie worth the watch and for all romantics a must watch.

review_title: a refreshing tale of an unending romance.....
review_detailed_main: This movie is certainly one of the best movies of Yash Chopra and even Shah rukh Khan's career. Even though the movie is little long as compared to an average movie runtime today but it never gets boring. Yash Chopra once again proves his mettle in romantic movies genre. The movie too lives up to its hype. The acting of all the actors are good but the movie belongs to Shah rukh khan. He as always is brilliant & katrina and anushka shine in their respective roles. Cameo roles by Rishi kapoor & Neetu Kapoor are well placed. The cinematography and locations in the movie are excellent. Music by A R rahman is fabulous. All in all an outstanding movie which will always be remembered as an excellent piece of cinematic experience.

This is so brilliant movie and so respectful, lovable movie ! The love and passion. No one does it better than Yash Chopra. And no one portrays it better than Shah Rukh Khan.

Shah Rukh Khan, as Samar, was flawless. Every single time. You think he's done it all. You think there won't be any novelty in his approach. And yet he comes and blows you away. The intensity he brings in, and the powerful control of emotions he displays is just brilliant.

Katrina Kaif did a really good job. She and Samar have a really great chemistry. In the scenes they are together, you totally see how much in love they are with each other.

Anushka sharma is bubbly and ' happy-go-lucky girl' who lives life to the fullest breathing every moment of her life happily. Brilliant expressions ! Most impressive in JTHJ !

A must watch movie backed by all the right reasons. JTHJ will be remembered as an EPIC !

review_title: The 'Six mistakes' Jab Tak Hai Jaan should not have had
Jab Tak Hai Jaan - A tale of unflinching love!
review_detailed_main:
At the outset, Jab Tak Hai Jaan is a very good movie. Nothing extraordinary. Its an honest and intense romantic film. A love story, the types that aren't made these days where South Indian remakes and mindless comedies reign supreme. So, if you are not the mushy romantic type, you may not enjoy it. There are many moments in the movie which are goosebumps inducing and leave a lump in your throat, and maybe, a tear in your eye. And yeah, watch out for the twists!

Katrina Kaif, in comparison to her earlier performances has improved a lot in this, but she has a long way to go. Looks very pretty though. Anushka Sharma is yet again, awesome and takes to her role like fish to water! But, this movie is a Shah Rukh Khan show completely. A beautiful performance by him. Jab Tak Hai Jaan is definitely in the league of his better movies. Looks like the genre of romance is tailor made for him. The intensity in his eyes is unbeatable.

The music is lovely. The songs may not have been chart busters till now, but the way they have been filmed changes that notion regarding A. R. Rahman's music. The locations, as expected in a Yash Chopra movie, are stunningly picturesque. Watch out for the choreography before the song 'Ishq Shava'. Splendid! Also, the end credits shouldn't be missed.

However, on the flip side, people may find the movie too long at around 3 hours, something that the movie going crowd isn't used to these days, where any movie over 2 hours may end up being considered a 'drag'! I didn't think so being a fan of movies like Kal Ho Naa Ho, K3G, Veer Zaara, etc. which were also around the 3 hour duration mark! Also, a stronger script may have just converted this movie from a 'very good movie' to an 'epic' movie! But alas, it is not.

However, those are minor issues in what is otherwise, a beautiful tale of love and longing. Here is a fitting farewell to a master of romantic movies, Yash Chopra, who once again, with his muse, Shah Rukh Khan, takes you into his world of unflinching love, hoping you get lost in it. Basically, if you're planning to watch it, and i think you should, don't go expecting some path breaking classic like a Veer Zaara or a Lamhe, and you will definitely leave the theater with a smile on your face, having fallen in love with the movie!

I definitely did! :)

I really cant believe that a marvelous director like Yashji directed the movie!! The storyline was full of flaws with unrealistic twists, music was average, acting was stereotype and several other unacceptable aspects. Katrina was as usual beautiful but with under average acting, Shahrukh with conventional acting, while Anushka with a lively performance. I wonder why Shahrukh couldn't come out of his lover boy attitude and get into some serious acting! While watching the movie it always feels that the movie was scripted to just highlight Shahrukh in every possible way...whether its realistic or not. A restaurant worker gets a high ranked post in Indian Army as a bomb disposal officer. Is that really believable? if that would have been the case then Indian restaurant workers would have decorated the highly admirable army posts as well. I believe that our favorite actors should focus more on versatility that than their preferred comfort zone of acting. Because that is the only thing that would save bollywood from creating movies like JTHJ.

There wasn't a single moment where Yash CHopra created magic like he did in his previous movies.

Many scenes in the movie were forced and didn't create any meaning to the story. The opening scene with Anushka Sharma did not make any sense when she jumps in the water. The whole scene with Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Singh did not make any sense.

Casting Anushka Sharma in this movie was a waste of her talent, cause she didn't get no scope.

First time that Katrina Kaif did an OK job, and SRK did OK but since its a Yash Chopra movie an OK is not enough.

This is the worse Yash Chopra movie I have seen, and what a waste that this became ur last.

The King of Romance behind the camera directing the Badshah of Romance in front of the camera. And a script that boasts of solid, undying love. No, there cannot be a better way to portray love on the silver screen. 'Jab Tak Hai Jaan' has nailed that – at least for the immediate future. Shah Rukh Khan, you don't really need words of praise or adulation; but go ahead and take a bow! With Samar Anand, the actor has brought another Raj Malhotra alive on screen. And a newer, better, improved version at that. One who doesn't know how not to love; one who instills in every heart the hope to be able to love – love unconditionally, love that doesn't know its limitations. Sounds like I'm just out of a Yash Chopra movie? Yes, this had to be the one.

Major Samar Anand, stationed with the Bomb Defusing Squad of the Indian Army is a man who flirts with death at every step of his life. He has successfully cut short the lives of ninety-seven bombs and is on his ninety-eighth one when the film begins. Wolf-whistle from all corners of the theatre greets the stubbled, sunglasses-clad man in uniform; oh yes, and a lot of claps too.

It's an awesome movie.... Great Job by Yash Ji, Shahrukh Khan & all actors. great direction and brilliant acting is what that sum up to a good movie. From the very beginning to the end, it was awesome. And what a music by Rahman Sahab.... Brilliant.... Hats off to Late Yash Ji. He has done it ! Grand locale, awesome cinematic experience. Shah Rukh Khan once again shows why he's one of the leading men in Bollywood, with his fine all round performance in being a younger man who is full of zeal, hope and life, with the world ahead of him given his hard work, and yet balancing that out with a more sullen, serious look as the hardened military man with a death wish, nursing a broken heart and resigned to the impossibility of challenging god. Absolutely marvelous movie....

Amid mad rush at a multiplex entrance, got the first glimpse of Jab tak hai jaan... A quintessential yash chopra love saga.... The first half drags just a little bit but overall an epic movie... No one in the world can portray romance on the screen better than SRK... His eyes talk so much... The man who cannot die forgets but does not forgive. A unique thing in this movie is that Katrina has acted.. The dance number before the Ishq shava song was something special. Many many twists in the movie. I thought the end of the movie gives a message against stupid superstitions. Don't dare to predict anything... You will always be on the wrong side.... Must watch !!!

Well, when it comes to romance... JTHJ is simply outstanding! Yash Chopra is a genius and he proved it again by his magical Direction which makes the film a master-piece but well could have been a Disaster because of a bad script. SRK showed yet again why he is the undisputed king of Romance by delivering a power-packed performance which is definitely, his best performance in recent times. Katrina looks stunning throughout the film and does "OK" in her glamorous NRI character which suits her well because of her accented Hindi. But she still is a bit plastic when it comes to emotions and needs improvement in this section. Anushka Sharma, on the other hand comes as the surprise package and brings life and a new age look to the movie.She did complete justice to the unorthodox but beautifully scripted role offered to her. Dialogues written by Aditya Chopra is amazing and compels you to relate each and every character of the movie. review_title: Hats off Yashji! The best possible end to such a brilliant innings.
review_detailed_main:
The grand show is over and I was out of the theater where a media person asked me what I felt about the movie as it being Yash Chopra's last. I replied, I wish new directors get inspired by Yashji and continue making such romantic movies forever. Because my only thought after the credits rolled down was, is this the end of the romance era which I grew up watching? Chandani, Lamhe, Darr, Dil to Pagal hai,Veer Zaara and now Jab tak hai jaan.

At 47, Shahrukh Khan was dapper and energetic as the young Samar Anand and was elegant as the intense older version. The reason he is the king of romance is that he lets you empathize every emotion he feels as a character. Katrina kaif as meera was OK at her act though showing some beautiful dance steps to prove that she is not just a barbie doll. Anushka sharma as Akira was bang 10/10 in her beauty and role execution. So charming and subtle at the same time. Anil Mehta is a genius. His beautiful cinematography in Kashmir, Ladakh and London is one the reasons that will hold u for this 3 hrs of escapist cinema.

The plot with all its creative liberties was still very good, though a bit stretched. Dialogues and costumes were really nice. A. R. Rehman's music, Gulzar's lyrics and Aditya Chopra's poem make the soul of the movie. Checkout the meaning of the songs 'Heer' and 'Challa', you will know what I mean.

Watch this movie ONLY if you like mushy romantic and eyes tearing emotional drama. As Yashji said, the best and the tastiest sweets are kept for the finale, my this review should also end in the same fashion. The best thing about Jab tak hai Jaan is Mr. Yash Chopra and this is one of his best directorial movies. I will miss him but will surely enjoy his cinema..jab tak hai jaan.

A movie after 8 years from the acclaimed personality, Yash Chopra, but is it really worth the wait? The answer is neither a complete yes nor a no. Technically the director has improved a lot in his movie making but still has not been able to use the story to its full potential mainly due to lazy editing and bollywood formulaic orientations.

The story starts with Samar Anand (Shahrukh Khan), a high ranking army officer working with bomb disposal squad, who is aka "the man who cannot die" for his daredevil ways of diffusing bombs. Samar meets Akira (Anushka Sharma) while rescuing her from drowning and covers her with his jacket to keep her warm where he mistakenly leaves his diary. She starts reading it and this is where the whole story of his youth and love in London is conveyed. Akira works with the Discovery channel where she's permitted to shoot her dream documentary on the bomb disposal squad after her persistent pleads. Here, she gets to know Samar deeper while also slowly developing feelings for him, and with this comes some pace and grip to the whole film towards an easy yet interesting conclusion to the tale.

Like usual, Shahrukh has been given the major responsibility of holding the movie together and he carries it well to some extent with his trademark style of romance and emotions. But I clearly wouldn't go so far to call it his second best after "Swades". Anushka is good, while Katrina looks better than her previous attempts. The foreign actors and the extras have done well with whatever little part they have been given (a rarity in bollywood). The cinematography is typical Yash Chopra with improved continuous shots, whereas the music is fresh and foot tapping though nowhere close to Rahman's bests. The first half shows a lot of promise but it gradually fades as it advances with the unconvincing presentation.

It surely is a culmination of all the Chopra's movies for its plot line and certain cinematic elements, whether it's the poetic harmony from "Veer-Zaara" or the youthfulness from "Dil Toh Pagal Hai", whether the maturity from "Silsila" or the intensity from "Deewar'. Thus, it succeeds in serving as a good conclusion in the filmography of the veteran film maker.

(imeansuraj.blogspot.in)

review_title: His legend will be difficult to match..
review_detailed_main:
Jab Tak Hai Jaan

Deewar, Daag, Waqt, Kabhie Kabhie, Trishul,Mashaal, Silsila,Chandni,Darr,Dil toh pagal hai,Veer-Zaara. Now coming to distinctions ;6 national awards,11 filmfare awards including 4 best directors,Dada saheb Phalke Award ,Padma Bhushan and the only Indian to become the life time member of BAFTA(British Academy of Film and Television Arts), 5 Honorary Doctorate degree and numerous Recognition from all over the world. You don't need to have an IQ of 160 plus to guess the name of the person being introduced above.He is the Legendary Mr Yash Chopra(Late). Now when a personality like Mr Chopra comes back to do what he does best ,the excitement among Fans and movie lovers especially in a media frenzy country like ours ,reaches gigantic heights.Thus Humungous expectations are inevitable, the desire to traverse the untraversed and the thirst to taste the Elixir becomes inescapable. This is the same enthusiasm with which I booked my tickets for the First day first show and entered the realms of the silver screen. The movie begins with Mr Chopra reciting a unheard stanza from the poem Jab Tak Hai Jaan.The Journey begins.

The movie has a very modest and fitting start which is beautifully shot in the Valleys of Ladakh. Every frame here looks like a postcard, such sequences are testimony to the fact that Mr Chopra had eyes for beauty like no one else. The Movie moves on with the story going backwards into the winter laden streets of London where Srk meets the love of his life floating like an angel in the midst of heavenly snowfall. The movie is filled with such beautifully shot sequences which clearly show the skill of a master filmmaker,who knows his craft like no one else.But disappointingly his craft is let down by his son 'Aditya Chopras' implausible story especially the hinge that connects the two timelines shown in the movie. If only he chose better reason for the separation of our 'Star Crossed ' lovers the movie would had been something else.There are many other places where the story should had been better written. Despite having a faulty story ,Yash Chopras exceptional treatment of the subject make the movie watchable and lovable in some places. Shahrukh Khan is called the 'Baadshah of Romance' and he shows us why girls go crazy for him. He is another pillar that keeps the ship above water till the end. He is in form after a long time and delivers one of his best performances ever(At least top 10). Nobody could have portrayed a character with emotional baggage better than him. He is truly the King. Anuskha Sharma is a natural and she proves her skills again and leaves an impression in almost every scene .In terms of acting, Katrina is a weak point.They should have taken a better actress for her character because it was complex and only a seasoned actor could do the job well. The music of the film is awesome but when Maestros like gulzar and AR Rahman come together you expect it to bring down rains but clearly our expectations went a little unsatisfied. So after all of the above Is JTHJ worth a watch??Should we invest our hard earned money in it? The answer is Yes, of course and how can you even ask such a question!!! The movie may have a defective storyline but it does have a story and it has the execution of a master storyteller .It could've been the best movie of the year or maybe the decade if only there were some tweaks in the story, some refinements which would had made huge difference to the impact it made on the audience. And and above all, Movies are as complex as humans,you just cant dismiss them as plain good or bad. They have shades, some bright some dark,only the intensity differs.

In the end all I could feel was there are few story tellers whose legends will be passed on to the next generations and Mr Yash chopra is one of them because his skill of portraying human emotions was exemplary and rare, simple but beautiful ,brilliant but close to the heart. Love will never be portrayed on screen like the way he could because he had the eyes to see what ours couldn't. Your Legacy will continue ,JAB TAK HAI JAAN

personally despite some flaws(which every movie has) i liked this movie inspite of me being a salman fan.really some great performances by king khan,katrina & anushka.if u love someone timelessly,this is d movie for u.every one may not like it as its all about the personal taste.some like masala movies wid ppl flying here n der,some like comedy movies which has a collection of SANTABANTA JOKES (SOS),but this movie just touches your heart.SONGS ARE JUST Awesome.they are like slow poison which gradually sinks in your heart.direction is spot on as usual being a yashraj movie.awesome movie.simply awesome.must watch this if you have a heart.

"Har ishq ka ek waqt hota hai" - A simple line rendered by Rishi Kapoor's character, Imran. By the end of the viewing, that is what this movie is mainly about. A love taking a couple of generations to mature. If we look at the big picture, JTHJ is merely another Yash Chopra Picture dealing with human relations.

If one goes back in time and looks at films such as Waqt, Daag, Deewar, Trishul, Silsila, Maashaal, Vijay, Lamhe, Darr, Veer Zaara etc. One notices that these Yash Chopra directed films delt with human emotions and relations above anything else. So does JTHJ live up to the humongous expectations? Does it live up to the name that is Yash Chopra? For the most part, Yes! Samar Annand is a Punjabi struggling to make a living in London. He bumps into Meera a few times here and there and then they start meeting consistently so that Samar can teach Meera to sing in Punjabi. (Reason is explained in the movie) They end up falling in love. However, circumstances and a promise to God from Meera leads them to break up. 10 years later, Samar is in the Indian Army enters Akira into his life. Why did Samar leave? Will they ever meet again? JTHJ doesn't leave any question unanswered.

What separates JTHJ from other Yash Chopra films is the whole modern feel of the movie. The characters using foul language, kissing scenes etc. However, the soul is surely the same and that's what separates JTHJ from other films of the year.

JTHJ may have the language of today, but it still has that Yash Chopra trademark of love, emotions and not to forget that Punjabi touch he puts in his films. That is surely there.

Other plus points in the movie are the twits/turns in the movie. Also, the chemistry between the lead pair is electrifying. The second half is actually pretty interesting for the most part. While the first half is excellent.

A scene I loved was in the second half when SRK-Katrina meet in the hospital. Add to that, there's a sequence in the second half when Samar shows Akira his past life 10 years ago. As a viewer, you see the scene just like Akira does. You realize how alive Samar is the same as Akira.

Flaws? The film could have been trimmed down a bit. The scenes before the climax start to drag a bit.

A special mention to the cinematography of Anil Mehta. The film is a visual treat. Whether it's London or Ladhak - Just beautiful.

Aditiya Chopra's story is good but it's the dialogue that does the trick here. Knowing Aditiya Chopra's past work, one expects some great lines and he delivers.

A.R. Rahman and Gulzar come up with a beautiful soundtrack. Each song is special. Challa being my favorite and Saans being the most soulful. Again, each song is picturised perfectly.

Katrina Kaif gives an elegant act. She looks gorgeous but also performs well. Given that her acting talent is limited, Chopra has extracted something out of her.

Anushka Sharma is a scene stealer. This is her best performance yet. Her energy, charisma, lines etc Just brilliant. She's sure to take great acclaim after this movie.

Rishi Kapoor, Neetu Singh, Anupam Kher all make nice cameos and do justice to their roles. The guy that plays SRK's roommate from Lahore is a delight.

All said and done, JTHJ is held on the shoulders of 2 giants. Actor Shah Rukh Khan and director Yash Chopra. SRK puts his best foot forward and gives another powerful performance. He has 2 distinct characters and he excels in both. If SRK carries the film in front of the camera, it's the man behind the camera that the film really belongs to. The late Yash Chopra's direction is nothing short of spectacular. He said he would make films till he died and he did just that.

Overall, JTHJ strikes the right chords. The story may not be the most interesting but it's the moments that make the movie. So do watch this Yash Chopra Romance!
